item.title: Python!
item.description: library(reticulate) ## Warning: package 'reticulate' was built under R version 3.5.2 Using re.findall on Python The re.findall function in python is a useful function that can help find text within strings. Heres an example! import re string1="We have to extract these numbers 12, 47, 48 The integers numbers are also interesting: 189 2036 314\',\' is a separator, so please extract these numbers 125,789,1450 and also these 564,90456 We like to offer you 7890$ per month in order to complete this task.

item.title: Projects
item.description: Projects Here are some of the projects I have been working on: Project 1 NFL -Project 1 Project 2 Pokemon -Project 2

item.title: Project 1
item.description: 2018 NFL Season For this firest project, I wanted to anaylize data on the NFL. Ever since I was a child, I have always been invested in the NFL. I love football and the amount of statistics that are involed in it. In these two datasets, I have all 2018 NFL season games with a variety of stats, such as scores, win probability, ELO rating, and much more all coming from FiveThirtyEight.
